content:

creator: bradford.s

content:
I have exactly the same response as christ1.

I am guessing like many folk you simply do not understand what a mail client is or you would not be making the statements you are.

Thunderbird needs access to your gmail account to get mail, or contacts or calendars I really have no idea what you set up to sync. The next page of the authorization flow will show what exactly you are asking Thunderbird to access.

It is that simple. Google have set the oAuth protocol to be the authentication method to get mail, contacts and calendars and that screen is requesting you sign into Google to provide authentication to Google for Thunderbird to have access to your data for the purpose of doing it's job. The next page of the flow indicated exactly what data is to be accessed.

I would guess you have syncronised contact or calendars if you have removed the email, but all I can do is guess.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I have sent a printscreen of the response to the Google query to sign in with google after I do sign in.

Accept cookies in Thunderbird - Settings/Privacy & Security. Turn off a VPN if used. When the OAuth window appears, enter the account (not app) password.

To be clear - I do not want my Google mail coming to my Tbird account anymore. Got it?

Clear as mud. I have no idea what you're talking about.

content:
I do not use gmail. What others have said in similar situations may be helpful.

You removed your gmail account, but, as you said, there may be a remnant. Some people have said that the remnant may be your calendar. It may be that you have done what is needed to prevent Thunderbird from dealing with e-mail messages in your gmail account, but another step is needed to remove all gmail access to your calendar. I'm sorry that I don't know what that step is. You may find it by searching this forum. Or just see if there is still a gmail calendar in Thunderbird and delete it.

Might be the same things for contacts. I do not know.

content: What do you call the "Draft" area? Do you mean the Draft folder? In Thunderbird go to Account Settings > accountname > Copies & Folders > Drafts & Templates > Keep draft messages on: and verify in which folder Thunderbird stores draft messages....

content: She named the folder "Kept Stuff" I found these two files: Kept Stuff.msf 177KB Kept Stuff 49.8MB Can I just copy paste these into her Tbird profile. Do I need to make a subfolder called "Kept Stuff" first?
creator: madmacs1

content: Ignore the msf, as that is just the index and thunderbird will recreate it. you can copy/paste to Mail\Local Folders folder when thunderbird isn't running OR you can install the importeporttools NG, and the highlight Local Folders, rightclick and select the importexport option to import mbox, and then select the kept stuff file

content:
The error console reports multiple errors when I try to only import messages. I tried importing all the settings and in this case the error console only reports this error:

Uncaught (in promise) NS_ERROR_FILE_NAME_TOO_LONG: Component returned failure code: 0x80520011 (NS_ERROR_FILE_NAME_TOO_LONG) [nsIFile.create] 

   _recursivelyCopyMsgFolder resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.sys.mjs:764    _recursivelyCopyMsgFolder resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.sys.mjs:765    _recursivelyCopyMsgFolder resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.sys.mjs:765    _recursivelyCopyMsgFolder resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.sys.mjs:765    _recursivelyCopyMsgFolder resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.sys.mjs:765    _recursivelyCopyMsgFolder resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.sys.mjs:765    _recursivelyCopyMsgFolder resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.sys.mjs:765    _recursivelyCopyMsgFolder resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.sys.mjs:765    _recursivelyCopyMsgFolder resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.sys.mjs:765    _mergeLocalFolders resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.sys.mjs:738    _importServersAndAccounts resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.sys.mjs:347
creator: tk982

content:
That source code is here https://searchfox.org/comm-central/source/mailnews/import/modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.sys.mjs Line 765 was last affected by changes in this bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1978987

However NS_ERROR_FILE_NAME_TOO_LONG is quite probably a very literal issue. Windows limits the length of a path to 260 characters approx. My guess is your folder structures is so deep that the copy fails because the path is just to long. Especially if you allow for the fact many profiles start somewhere around 80 of those characters from the root of the C: drive.

The error however can simply mean you do not have write access to the relevant disk area either through file contention(Your anti virus is often a culprit for this problem) or the drive being full so the error is that there is no space to the file and it bubbles up as a file length issue. This is a relatively generic JavaScript error. So google can help with ideas as to the cause and I do not mean just as it relates to Thunderbird.

You might also want to check your new installation does not have the system integration to allow Windows search to search mails allowed as that adds another duplicate layer of mail in lower down the folder tree. Mozmsgs folders with mozeml files. Individual file names are based on the email subject and are a prime source of the path becoming to long.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: There is no summary file called "Inbox". Inbox (no suffix) is a message folder (and the name of the mailbox file in the profile) where Thunderbird stores incoming messages. The corresponding summary file in the profile is called Inbox.msf but there is no need to open the .msf file. If you want to "repair" the folder Inbox you have to R-click the folder Inbox, choose Properties and then Repair
creator: Mapenzi
